metaInfos.description: Should be an estimate for the energy gap [a.u.] (HOMO-LUMO) and is used in preconditioning, especially effective with the FULL_ALL preconditioner, in which case it should be an underestimate of the gap (can be a small number, e.g. 0.002). FULL_SINGLE_INVERSE takes it as lower bound (values below 0.05 can cause stability issues). In general, heigher values will tame the preconditioner in case of poor initial guesses. A negative value will leave the choice to CP2K depending on type of preconditioner.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_ot_energy_gap

metaInfos.description: Sets the threshold for filtering the matrices.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_ot_eps_irac_filter_matrix

metaInfos.description: Only one extra refinement iteration is done when the norm is below this value.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_ot_eps_irac_quick_exit

metaInfos.description: The algorithm switches to the polynomial refinement when the norm is below this value.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_ot_eps_irac_switch

metaInfos.description: Targeted accuracy during the refinement iteration.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_ot_eps_irac

metaInfos.description: Target accuracy of the taylor expansion for the matrix functions, should normally be kept as is.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_ot_eps_taylor

metaInfos.description: Target relative uncertainty in the location of the minimum for LINESEARCH GOLD
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_ot_gold_target

metaInfos.description: The refinement polynomial degree (2, 3 or 4).
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_ot_irac_degree

metaInfos.description: 1D line search algorithm to be used with the OT minimizer, in increasing order of robustness and cost. MINIMIZER CG combined with LINESEARCH GOLD should always find an electronic minimum.  Whereas the 2PNT minimizer is almost always OK, 3PNT might be needed for systems in which successive OT CG steps do not decrease the total energy.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_ot_linesearch

metaInfos.description: Maximum allowed refinement iteration.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_ot_max_irac

metaInfos.description: Maximum order of the Taylor expansion before diagonalisation is prefered, for large parallel runs a slightly higher order could sometimes result in a small speedup.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_ot_max_taylor

metaInfos.description: Minimizer to be used with the OT method
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_ot_minimizer

metaInfos.description: Uses a mixed precision algorithm.With a well behaved basis set (i.e. condition number less than 1/eps_sp)it provides double precision accuracy results and up to a 2 fold speedup for building and applying the preconditioner.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_ot_mixed_precision

metaInfos.description: Number of history vectors to be used with DIIS or BROYDEN
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_ot_n_history_vec

metaInfos.description: The prefactor for the non-diagonal energy penalty (FD smearing)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_ot_nondiag_energy_strength

metaInfos.description: Add a non-diagonal energy penalty (FD smearing)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_ot_nondiag_energy

metaInfos.description: Preconditioner with the occupation numbers (FD smearing)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_ot_occupation_preconditioner

metaInfos.description: On the fly localization of the molecular orbitals. Can only be used with OT/IRAC.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_ot_on_the_fly_loc

metaInfos.description: The orthogonality method.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_ot_ortho_irac

metaInfos.description: How the preconditioner is applied to the residual.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_ot_precond_solver

metaInfos.description: Type of preconditioner to be used with all minimization schemes. They differ in effectiveness, cost of construction, cost of application. Properly preconditioned minimization can be orders of magnitude faster than doing nothing.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_ot_preconditioner

metaInfos.description: Introduce additional variables so that rotations of the occupied subspace are allowed as well, only needed for cases where the energy is not invariant under  a rotation of the occupied subspace such as non-singlet restricted calculations  or fractional occupations.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_ot_rotation

metaInfos.description: Reject DIIS steps if they point away from the minimum, do SD in that case.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_ot_safe_diis

metaInfos.description: Introduce additional self-consistent polarization through response basis set = orbital basis set for NDDO.)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_ot_scp_nddo

metaInfos.description: controls the activation of the ot method
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_ot_section_parameters

metaInfos.description: Initial stepsize used for the line search, sometimes this parameter can be reduced to stablize DIIS or to improve the CG behavior in the first few steps. The optimal value depends on the quality of the preconditioner. A negative values leaves the choice to CP2K depending on the preconditioner.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_ot_stepsize

metaInfos.description: Maximum number of times the same point will be used in bisection, a small number guards against the effect of wrongly converged states.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_outer_scf_bisect_trust_count

metaInfos.description: Maximum number of DIIS vectors used
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_outer_scf_diis_buffer_length

metaInfos.description: The target gradient of the outer scf variables. Notice that the EPS_SCF of the inner loop also determines the value that can be reached in the outer loop, typically EPS_SCF of the outer loop must be smaller than EPS_SCF of the inner loop.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_outer_scf_eps_scf

metaInfos.description: Number of past states used in the extrapolation of the variables during e.g. MD
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_outer_scf_extrapolation_order

metaInfos.description: The maximum number of outer loops
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_outer_scf_max_scf

metaInfos.description: Method used to bring the outer loop to a stationary point
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_outer_scf_optimizer

metaInfos.description: controls the activation of the outer SCF loop
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_outer_scf_section_parameters

metaInfos.description: The initial step_size used in the optimizer (currently steepest descent).Note that in cases where a sadle point is sought for (DDAPC_CONSTRAINT), this can be negative
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_outer_scf_step_size

metaInfos.description: Specifies which kind of outer SCF should be employed
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_outer_scf_type

metaInfos.description: Allows to define the parameter f for the general ROKS scheme.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_roks_f

metaInfos.description: Allows to define all parameters for the high-spin ROKS scheme explicitly. The full set of 6 parameters has to be specified in the order acc, bcc, aoo, boo, avv, bvv
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_roks_parameters

metaInfos.description: Selects the ROKS scheme when ROKS is applied.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_roks_scheme

metaInfos.description: Change the initial guess for the wavefunction.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_scf_guess

metaInfos.description: Electronic temperature in the case of Fermi-Dirac smearing
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_smear_electronic_temperature

metaInfos.description: Accuracy checks on occupation numbers use this as a tolerance
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_smear_eps_fermi_dirac

metaInfos.description: Imposed difference between the numbers of electrons of spin up and spin down: m = n(up) - n(down). A negative value (default) allows for a change of the magnetic moment. -1 specifically keeps an integer number of spin up and spin down electrons.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_smear_fixed_magnetic_moment

metaInfos.description: A list of fractional occupations to use. Must match the number of states and sum up to the correct number of electrons
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_smear_list

metaInfos.description: Smearing method to be applied
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_smear_method

metaInfos.description: Controls the activation of smearing
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_smear_section_parameters

metaInfos.description: Size of the energy window centred at the Fermi level
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scf_smear_window_size

metaInfos.description: Value of the dielectric constant outside the sphere
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scrf_eps_out

metaInfos.description: Maximum value of L used in the multipole expansion
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scrf_lmax

metaInfos.description: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with lowercase letter l) or with the iteration number. Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scrf_program_run_info_add_last

metaInfos.description: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scrf_program_run_info_common_iteration_levels

metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scrf_program_run_info_filename

metaInfos.description: This keywords enables the logger for the print_key (a message is printed on screen everytime data, controlled by this print_key, are written)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scrf_program_run_info_log_print_key

metaInfos.description: Level starting at which this proprety is printed
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scrf_program_run_info_section_parameters

metaInfos.description: Defines a list of atoms to define the center of the sphere
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scrf_sphere_center_atom_list

metaInfos.description: Specify if the center of the sphere should be fixed or allowed to move
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scrf_sphere_center_fixed

metaInfos.description: Defines the weight used to define the center of the sphere (if ATOM_LIST is provided)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scrf_sphere_center_weight_type

metaInfos.description: Coordinates of the center of the sphere
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scrf_sphere_center_xyz

metaInfos.description: Value of the spherical cavity in the dielectric medium
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_scrf_sphere_radius

metaInfos.description: Type of orbitals treated with the SIC
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_sic_orbital_set

metaInfos.description: Method used to remove the self interaction
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_sic_sic_method

metaInfos.description: Scaling of the coulomb term in sic [experimental]
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_sic_sic_scaling_a

metaInfos.description: Scaling of the xc term in sic [experimental]
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_sic_sic_scaling_b

metaInfos.description: Read the grid size for subcell generation in the construction of neighbor lists.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_subcells

metaInfos.description: Cartesian axis parallel to surface normal.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_surf_dip_dir

metaInfos.description: For slab calculations with asymmetric geometries, activate the correction of  the electrostatic potential with by compensating for the surface dipole. Implemented only for slabs with normal  parallel to one Cartesian axis. The normal direction is given by the keyword SURF_DIP_DIR
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_surface_dipole_correction

metaInfos.description: The convergence of the eigenvalues
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_convergence

metaInfos.description: Diagonalization method used in tddfpt
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_diag_method

metaInfos.description: use the inverse of the overlap matrix
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_invert_s

metaInfos.description: compute the kernel (debug purpose only)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_kernel

metaInfos.description: compute singlets using lsd vxc kernel
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_lsd_singlets

metaInfos.description: maximal number of Krylov space vectors
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_max_kv

metaInfos.description: number of excitations to calculate
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_nev

metaInfos.description: number of additional unoccupied orbitals
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_nlumo

metaInfos.description: number of reorthogonalization steps
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_nreortho

metaInfos.description: Which type of orbital eigenvalue correction to use\n(to yield better HOMO-LUMO energies)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_oe_corr

metaInfos.description: use the preconditioner (only for Davidson)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_preconditioner

metaInfos.description: (singlets/triplets) for restricted calculation
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_res_etype

metaInfos.description: maximal number subspace search restarts
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_restarts

metaInfos.description: Type of orbitals treated with the SIC
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_sic_orbital_set

metaInfos.description: Method used to remove the self interaction
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_sic_sic_method

metaInfos.description: Scaling of the coulomb term in sic [experimental]
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_sic_sic_scaling_a

metaInfos.description: Scaling of the xc term in sic [experimental]
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_sic_sic_scaling_b

metaInfos.description: Which model for the coupling constant integration should be used.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_adiabatic_rescaling_functional_model

metaInfos.description: Which Hybrid functional should be used. (Has to be consistent with the definitions in XC and HF).
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_adiabatic_rescaling_functional_type

metaInfos.description: The point to be used along the adiabatic curve (0 < Î» < 1)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_adiabatic_rescaling_lambda

metaInfos.description: Long-range parameter
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_adiabatic_rescaling_omega

metaInfos.description: The cutoff on the density used by the xc calculation
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_density_cutoff

metaInfos.description: Parameter for the smoothing procedure inxc calculation
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_density_smooth_cutoff_range

metaInfos.description: Select the code for xc calculation
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_functional_routine

metaInfos.description: The cutoff on the gradient of the density used by the xc calculation
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_gradient_cutoff

metaInfos.description: The fraction of Hartree-Fock to add to the total energy. 1.0 implies standard Hartree-Fock if used with XC_FUNCTIONAL NONE. NOTE: In a mixed potential calculation this should be set to 1.0, otherwise all parts are multiplied with this factor.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_fraction

metaInfos.description: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with lowercase letter l) or with the iteration number. Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_hf_info_add_last

metaInfos.description: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_hf_info_common_iteration_levels

metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_hf_info_filename

metaInfos.description: This keywords enables the logger for the print_key (a message is printed on screen everytime data, controlled by this print_key, are written)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_hf_info_log_print_key

metaInfos.description: Level starting at which this proprety is printed
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_hf_info_section_parameters

metaInfos.description: Accuracy of iterative RI fit
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_hfx_ri_eps_optimization

metaInfos.description: Accuracy of geminal integral evaluation
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_hfx_ri_eps_screening

metaInfos.description: Maximum number of iteration in RI fit
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_hfx_ri_max_iter

metaInfos.description: Determines cutoff radius for the truncated 1/r potential. Only valid when doing truncated calculation
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_interaction_potential_cutoff_radius

metaInfos.description: Parameter for short/longrange interaction
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_interaction_potential_omega

metaInfos.description: Which interaction potential should be used (Coulomb, longrange or shortrange).
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_interaction_potential_potential_type

metaInfos.description: Scales Hartree-Fock contribution arising from a coulomb potential. Only valid when doing a mixed potential calculation
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_interaction_potential_scale_coulomb

metaInfos.description: Scales Hartree-Fock contribution arising from a gaussian potential. Only valid when doing a mixed potential calculation
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_interaction_potential_scale_gaussian

metaInfos.description: Scales Hartree-Fock contribution arising from a longrange potential. Only valid when doing a mixed potential calculation
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_interaction_potential_scale_longrange

metaInfos.description: Location of the file t_c_g.dat that contains the data for the evaluation of the truncated gamma function
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_interaction_potential_t_c_g_data

metaInfos.description: Determines the blocking used for the atomic quartet loops. A proper choice can speedup the calculation. The default (-1) is automatic.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_load_balance_block_size

metaInfos.description: Number of bins per process used to group atom quartets.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_load_balance_nbins

metaInfos.description: This flag controls the randomization of the bin assignment to processes. For highly ordered input structures with a bad load balance, setting this flag to TRUE might improve.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_load_balance_randomize

metaInfos.description: Scaling factor to scale eps_schwarz. Storage threshold for compression will be EPS_SCHWARZ*EPS_STORAGE_SCALING.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_memory_eps_storage_scaling

metaInfos.description: Defines the maximum amount of disk space [MB] used to store precomputed compressed four-center integrals. If 0, nothing is stored to disk
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_memory_max_disk_space

metaInfos.description: Defines the maximum amount of memory [MB] to be consumed by the full HFX module. All temporary buffers and helper arrays are subtracted from this number. What remains will be used for storage of integrals. NOTE: This number is assumed to represent the memory available to one MPI process. When running a threaded version, cp2k automatically takes care of distributing the memory among all the threads within a process.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_memory_max_memory

metaInfos.description: Loaction where ERI's are stored if MAX_DISK_SPACE /=0 Expects a path to a directory.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_memory_storage_location

metaInfos.description: Determines whether the derivative ERI's should be stored to RAM or not. Only meaningful when performing Ehrenfest MD. Memory usage is defined via MAX_MEMORY, i.e. the memory is shared wit the energy ERI's.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_memory_treat_forces_in_core

metaInfos.description: Number of shells taken into account for periodicity. By default, cp2k tries to automatically evaluate this number. This algorithm might be to conservative, resulting in some overhead. You can try to adjust this number in order to make a calculation cheaper.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_periodic_number_of_shells

metaInfos.description: Improve the performance of pw_hfx at the cost of some additional memory by storing the realspace representation of PW_HFX_BLOCKSIZE states.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_pw_hfx_blocksize

metaInfos.description: Compute the Hartree-Fock energy also in the plane wave basis.The value is ignored, and intended for debugging only.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_pw_hfx

metaInfos.description: Screens the near field part of the electronic repulsion integrals using the Schwarz inequality for the given threshold. This will be approximately the accuracy of the forces,  and should normally be similar to EPS_SCF
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_screening_eps_schwarz_forces

metaInfos.description: Screens the near field part of the electronic repulsion integrals using the Schwarz inequality for the given threshold.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_screening_eps_schwarz

metaInfos.description: Recalculates integrals on the fly if the actual density matrix is larger by a given factor than the initial one. If the factor is set to 0.0_dp, this feature is disabled.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_screening_p_screen_correction_factor

metaInfos.description: Screen on an initial density matrix. For the first MD step this matrix must be provided by a Restart File.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_screening_screen_on_initial_p

metaInfos.description: Screens the electronic repulsion integrals for the forces using the density matrix. This results in a significant speedup for large systems, but might require a somewhat tigher EPS_SCHWARZ_FORCES.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_screening_screen_p_forces

metaInfos.description: Determines how spin denisities are taken into account. If true, the beta spin density is included via a second in core call. If false, alpha and beta spins are done in one shot
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_hf_treat_lsd_in_core

metaInfos.description: The cutoff on tau used by the xc calculation

Default is to use all processors (GROUP_SIZE=-1).A smaller group size (for example the node size), might a better choice if the actual MP2 time is large compared to integral computation time. This is usually the case if the total number of processors is not too large.

metaInfos.description: Specifies the size of the auxiliary basis set automatically generated as initial guess. This will be effective only if RI_AUX_BASIS_SET in the KIND section and NUM_FUNC are not specified.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_wf_correlation_ri_laplace_quadrature_points

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_interaction_potential_cutoff_radius

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_interaction_potential_t_c_g_data

metaInfos.description: Determines the blocking used for the atomic quartet loops. A proper choice can speedup the calculation. The default (-1) is automatic.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_load_balance_block_size

metaInfos.description: Number of bins per process used to group atom quartets.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_load_balance_nbins

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_memory_max_disk_space

metaInfos.description: Defines the maximum amount of memory [MB] to be consumed by the full HFX module. All temporary buffers and helper arrays are subtracted from this number. What remains will be used for storage of integrals. NOTE: This number is assumed to represent the memory available to one MPI process. When running a threaded version, cp2k automatically takes care of distributing the memory among all the threads within a process.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_memory_max_memory

metaInfos.description: Loaction where ERI's are stored if MAX_DISK_SPACE /=0 Expects a path to a directory.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_memory_storage_location

metaInfos.description: Determines whether the derivative ERI's should be stored to RAM or not. Only meaningful when performing Ehrenfest MD. Memory usage is defined via MAX_MEMORY, i.e. the memory is shared wit the energy ERI's.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_memory_treat_forces_in_core

metaInfos.description: Number of shells taken into account for periodicity. By default, cp2k tries to automatically evaluate this number. This algorithm might be to conservative, resulting in some overhead. You can try to adjust this number in order to make a calculation cheaper.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_periodic_number_of_shells

metaInfos.description: Improve the performance of pw_hfx at the cost of some additional memory by storing the realspace representation of PW_HFX_BLOCKSIZE states.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_pw_hfx_blocksize

metaInfos.description: Compute the Hartree-Fock energy also in the plane wave basis.The value is ignored, and intended for debugging only.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_pw_hfx

metaInfos.description: Screens the near field part of the electronic repulsion integrals using the Schwarz inequality for the given threshold. This will be approximately the accuracy of the forces,  and should normally be similar to EPS_SCF
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_screening_eps_schwarz_forces

metaInfos.description: Screens the near field part of the electronic repulsion integrals using the Schwarz inequality for the given threshold.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_screening_eps_schwarz

metaInfos.description: Recalculates integrals on the fly if the actual density matrix is larger by a given factor than the initial one. If the factor is set to 0.0_dp, this feature is disabled.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_screening_p_screen_correction_factor

metaInfos.description: Screen on an initial density matrix. For the first MD step this matrix must be provided by a Restart File.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_screening_screen_on_initial_p

metaInfos.description: Screens the electronic repulsion integrals for the forces using the density matrix. This results in a significant speedup for large systems, but might require a somewhat tigher EPS_SCHWARZ_FORCES.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_screening_screen_p_forces

metaInfos.description: Determines how spin denisities are taken into account. If true, the beta spin density is included via a second in core call. If false, alpha and beta spins are done in one shot
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_treat_lsd_in_core

metaInfos.description: Use the Minimax quadrature scheme for performing the numerical integration. Maximum number of quadrature point limited to 20.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_minimax_quadrature

metaInfos.description: Matrix multiplication style for the Q matrix.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_mm_style

metaInfos.description: Number of quadrature points for the numerical integration in the RI-RPA method.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_quadrature_points

metaInfos.description: Group size for frequency integration, that is the number of processes involved in the computation of each integration point. SIZE_FREQ_INTEG_GROUP has to be a multiple of GROUP_SIZE in the WF_CORRELATION section. The default (-1) is automatic.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_size_freq_integ_group

metaInfos.description: Size of the row block used in the SCALAPACK block cyclic data distribution.Default is (ROW_BLOCK=-1) is automatic. A proper choice can speedup the parallel matrix multiplication in the case of RI-RPA and RI-SOS-MP2-Laplace.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_wf_correlation_row_block

metaInfos.description: Scaling factor of the singlet energy component (opposite spin, OS).
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_wf_correlation_scale_s

metaInfos.description: Scaling factor of the triplet energy component (same spin, SS).
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_wf_correlation_scale_t

metaInfos.description: The cutoff of the finest grid level in the MP2 gpw integration.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_tddfpt_xc_wf_correlation_wfc_gpw_cutoff

metaInfos.description: Below this threshold value for the SCF convergence the pseudo-diagonalization method using Jacobi rotations is activated. This method is much faster than a real diagonalization and it is even speeding up while achieving full convergence.However, it needs a pre-converged wavefunction obtained by at least one real diagonalization which is further optimized while keeping the original eigenvalue spectrum. The MO eigenvalues are NOT updated. The method might be useful to speed up calculations for large systems e.g. using a semi-empirical method.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_diagonalization_ot_energies

metaInfos.description: Should be an estimate for the energy gap [a.u.] (HOMO-LUMO) and is used in preconditioning, especially effective with the FULL_ALL preconditioner, in which case it should be an underestimate of the gap (can be a small number, e.g. 0.002). FULL_SINGLE_INVERSE takes it as lower bound (values below 0.05 can cause stability issues). In general, heigher values will tame the preconditioner in case of poor initial guesses. A negative value will leave the choice to CP2K depending on type of preconditioner.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_diagonalization_ot_energy_gap

metaInfos.description: Sets the threshold for filtering the matrices.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_diagonalization_ot_eps_irac_filter_matrix

metaInfos.description: Only one extra refinement iteration is done when the norm is below this value.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_diagonalization_ot_eps_irac_quick_exit

metaInfos.description: The algorithm switches to the polynomial refinement when the norm is below this value.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_diagonalization_ot_eps_irac_switch

metaInfos.description: Targeted accuracy during the refinement iteration.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_diagonalization_ot_eps_irac

metaInfos.description: Target accuracy of the taylor expansion for the matrix functions, should normally be kept as is.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_diagonalization_ot_eps_taylor

metaInfos.description: Target relative uncertainty in the location of the minimum for LINESEARCH GOLD
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_diagonalization_ot_gold_target

metaInfos.description: The refinement polynomial degree (2, 3 or 4).
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_diagonalization_ot_irac_degree

metaInfos.description: 1D line search algorithm to be used with the OT minimizer, in increasing order of robustness and cost. MINIMIZER CG combined with LINESEARCH GOLD should always find an electronic minimum.  Whereas the 2PNT minimizer is almost always OK, 3PNT might be needed for systems in which successive OT CG steps do not decrease the total energy.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_diagonalization_ot_linesearch

metaInfos.description: Maximum allowed refinement iteration.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_diagonalization_ot_max_irac

metaInfos.description: Maximum order of the Taylor expansion before diagonalisation is prefered, for large parallel runs a slightly higher order could sometimes result in a small speedup.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_diagonalization_ot_max_taylor

metaInfos.description: Minimizer to be used with the OT method
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_diagonalization_ot_minimizer

metaInfos.description: Uses a mixed precision algorithm.With a well behaved basis set (i.e. condition number less than 1/eps_sp)it provides double precision accuracy results and up to a 2 fold speedup for building and applying the preconditioner.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_diagonalization_ot_mixed_precision

metaInfos.description: Number of history vectors to be used with DIIS or BROYDEN

metaInfos.description: Type of preconditioner to be used with all minimization schemes. They differ in effectiveness, cost of construction, cost of application. Properly preconditioned minimization can be orders of magnitude faster than doing nothing.

metaInfos.description: Introduce additional variables so that rotations of the occupied subspace are allowed as well, only needed for cases where the energy is not invariant under  a rotation of the occupied subspace such as non-singlet restricted calculations  or fractional occupations.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_diagonalization_ot_rotation

metaInfos.description: Reject DIIS steps if they point away from the minimum, do SD in that case.

metaInfos.description: Maximum allowed refinement iteration.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_ot_max_irac

metaInfos.description: Maximum order of the Taylor expansion before diagonalisation is prefered, for large parallel runs a slightly higher order could sometimes result in a small speedup.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_ot_max_taylor

metaInfos.description: Minimizer to be used with the OT method
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_ot_minimizer

metaInfos.description: Uses a mixed precision algorithm.With a well behaved basis set (i.e. condition number less than 1/eps_sp)it provides double precision accuracy results and up to a 2 fold speedup for building and applying the preconditioner.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_ot_mixed_precision

metaInfos.description: Number of history vectors to be used with DIIS or BROYDEN
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_ot_n_history_vec

metaInfos.description: The prefactor for the non-diagonal energy penalty (FD smearing)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_ot_nondiag_energy_strength

metaInfos.description: Add a non-diagonal energy penalty (FD smearing)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_ot_nondiag_energy

metaInfos.description: Preconditioner with the occupation numbers (FD smearing)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_ot_occupation_preconditioner

metaInfos.description: On the fly localization of the molecular orbitals. Can only be used with OT/IRAC.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_ot_on_the_fly_loc

metaInfos.description: The orthogonality method.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_ot_ortho_irac

metaInfos.description: How the preconditioner is applied to the residual.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_ot_precond_solver

metaInfos.description: Type of preconditioner to be used with all minimization schemes. They differ in effectiveness, cost of construction, cost of application. Properly preconditioned minimization can be orders of magnitude faster than doing nothing.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_ot_preconditioner

metaInfos.description: Introduce additional variables so that rotations of the occupied subspace are allowed as well, only needed for cases where the energy is not invariant under  a rotation of the occupied subspace such as non-singlet restricted calculations  or fractional occupations.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_ot_rotation

metaInfos.description: Reject DIIS steps if they point away from the minimum, do SD in that case.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_ot_safe_diis

metaInfos.description: Introduce additional self-consistent polarization through response basis set = orbital basis set for NDDO.)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_ot_scp_nddo

metaInfos.description: controls the activation of the ot method
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_ot_section_parameters

metaInfos.description: Initial stepsize used for the line search, sometimes this parameter can be reduced to stablize DIIS or to improve the CG behavior in the first few steps. The optimal value depends on the quality of the preconditioner. A negative values leaves the choice to CP2K depending on the preconditioner.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_ot_stepsize

metaInfos.description: Maximum number of times the same point will be used in bisection, a small number guards against the effect of wrongly converged states.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_outer_scf_bisect_trust_count

metaInfos.description: Maximum number of DIIS vectors used
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_outer_scf_diis_buffer_length

metaInfos.description: The target gradient of the outer scf variables. Notice that the EPS_SCF of the inner loop also determines the value that can be reached in the outer loop, typically EPS_SCF of the outer loop must be smaller than EPS_SCF of the inner loop.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_outer_scf_eps_scf

metaInfos.description: Number of past states used in the extrapolation of the variables during e.g. MD
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_outer_scf_extrapolation_order

metaInfos.description: The maximum number of outer loops
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_outer_scf_max_scf

metaInfos.description: Method used to bring the outer loop to a stationary point
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_outer_scf_optimizer

metaInfos.description: controls the activation of the outer SCF loop
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_outer_scf_section_parameters

metaInfos.description: The initial step_size used in the optimizer (currently steepest descent).Note that in cases where a sadle point is sought for (DDAPC_CONSTRAINT), this can be negative
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_outer_scf_step_size

metaInfos.description: Specifies which kind of outer SCF should be employed
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_outer_scf_type

metaInfos.description: Allows to define the parameter f for the general ROKS scheme.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_roks_f

metaInfos.description: Allows to define all parameters for the high-spin ROKS scheme explicitly. The full set of 6 parameters has to be specified in the order acc, bcc, aoo, boo, avv, bvv
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_roks_parameters

metaInfos.description: Selects the ROKS scheme when ROKS is applied.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_roks_scheme

metaInfos.description: Change the initial guess for the wavefunction.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_scf_guess

metaInfos.description: Electronic temperature in the case of Fermi-Dirac smearing
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_smear_electronic_temperature

metaInfos.description: Accuracy checks on occupation numbers use this as a tolerance
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_smear_eps_fermi_dirac

metaInfos.description: Imposed difference between the numbers of electrons of spin up and spin down: m = n(up) - n(down). A negative value (default) allows for a change of the magnetic moment. -1 specifically keeps an integer number of spin up and spin down electrons.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_smear_fixed_magnetic_moment

metaInfos.description: A list of fractional occupations to use. Must match the number of states and sum up to the correct number of electrons
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_smear_list

metaInfos.description: Smearing method to be applied
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_smear_method

metaInfos.description: Controls the activation of smearing
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_smear_section_parameters

metaInfos.description: Size of the energy window centred at the Fermi level
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_scf_smear_window_size

metaInfos.description: controls the activation of core-level spectroscopy simulations
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_section_parameters

metaInfos.description: # of states where to look for the one to be excited
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_state_search

metaInfos.description: Type of the orbitas that are excited for the xas spectra calculation
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_state_type

metaInfos.description: Root of the file names where to read the MOS fromwhich to restart the calculation of the core level excited states
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_wfn_restart_file_name

metaInfos.description: Occupation of the core state in XAS calculation by TP_FLEX.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_xas_core

metaInfos.description: Total number of electrons for spin channel alpha, in XAS calculation by TP_FLEX.If negative value, the number of electrons is set to GS number of electron  minus the amount subtracted from the core state
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_xas_tot_el

metaInfos.description: Occupation of the core state in XES calculation by TP_VAL.The homo is emptied by the same amount
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_xes_core

metaInfos.description: Set the occupation of the HOMO in XES calculation by TP_VAL.The HOMO can be emptied or not, if the core is still full
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xas_xes_empty_homo

metaInfos.description: Which model for the coupling constant integration should be used.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_adiabatic_rescaling_functional_model

metaInfos.description: Which Hybrid functional should be used. (Has to be consistent with the definitions in XC and HF).
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_adiabatic_rescaling_functional_type

metaInfos.description: The point to be used along the adiabatic curve (0 < Î» < 1)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_adiabatic_rescaling_lambda

metaInfos.description: Long-range parameter
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_adiabatic_rescaling_omega

metaInfos.description: The cutoff on the density used by the xc calculation
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_density_cutoff

metaInfos.description: Parameter for the smoothing procedure inxc calculation
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_density_smooth_cutoff_range

metaInfos.description: Select the code for xc calculation
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_functional_routine

metaInfos.description: The cutoff on the gradient of the density used by the xc calculation
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_gradient_cutoff

metaInfos.description: The fraction of Hartree-Fock to add to the total energy. 1.0 implies standard Hartree-Fock if used with XC_FUNCTIONAL NONE. NOTE: In a mixed potential calculation this should be set to 1.0, otherwise all parts are multiplied with this factor.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_fraction

metaInfos.description: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with lowercase letter l) or with the iteration number. Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_hf_info_add_last

metaInfos.description: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_hf_info_common_iteration_levels

metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_hf_info_filename

metaInfos.description: This keywords enables the logger for the print_key (a message is printed on screen everytime data, controlled by this print_key, are written)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_hf_info_log_print_key

metaInfos.description: Level starting at which this proprety is printed
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_hf_info_section_parameters

metaInfos.description: Accuracy of iterative RI fit
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_hfx_ri_eps_optimization

metaInfos.description: Accuracy of geminal integral evaluation
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_hfx_ri_eps_screening

metaInfos.description: Maximum number of iteration in RI fit
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_hfx_ri_max_iter

metaInfos.description: Determines cutoff radius for the truncated 1/r potential. Only valid when doing truncated calculation
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_interaction_potential_cutoff_radius

metaInfos.description: Parameter for short/longrange interaction
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_interaction_potential_omega

metaInfos.description: Which interaction potential should be used (Coulomb, longrange or shortrange).
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_interaction_potential_potential_type

metaInfos.description: Scales Hartree-Fock contribution arising from a coulomb potential. Only valid when doing a mixed potential calculation
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_interaction_potential_scale_coulomb

metaInfos.description: Scales Hartree-Fock contribution arising from a gaussian potential. Only valid when doing a mixed potential calculation
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_interaction_potential_scale_gaussian

metaInfos.description: Scales Hartree-Fock contribution arising from a longrange potential. Only valid when doing a mixed potential calculation
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_interaction_potential_scale_longrange

metaInfos.description: Location of the file t_c_g.dat that contains the data for the evaluation of the truncated gamma function
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_interaction_potential_t_c_g_data

metaInfos.description: Determines the blocking used for the atomic quartet loops. A proper choice can speedup the calculation. The default (-1) is automatic.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_load_balance_block_size

metaInfos.description: Number of bins per process used to group atom quartets.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_load_balance_nbins

metaInfos.description: This flag controls the randomization of the bin assignment to processes. For highly ordered input structures with a bad load balance, setting this flag to TRUE might improve.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_load_balance_randomize

metaInfos.description: Scaling factor to scale eps_schwarz. Storage threshold for compression will be EPS_SCHWARZ*EPS_STORAGE_SCALING.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_memory_eps_storage_scaling

metaInfos.description: Defines the maximum amount of disk space [MB] used to store precomputed compressed four-center integrals. If 0, nothing is stored to disk
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_memory_max_disk_space

metaInfos.description: Defines the maximum amount of memory [MB] to be consumed by the full HFX module. All temporary buffers and helper arrays are subtracted from this number. What remains will be used for storage of integrals. NOTE: This number is assumed to represent the memory available to one MPI process. When running a threaded version, cp2k automatically takes care of distributing the memory among all the threads within a process.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_memory_max_memory

metaInfos.description: Loaction where ERI's are stored if MAX_DISK_SPACE /=0 Expects a path to a directory.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_memory_storage_location

metaInfos.description: Determines whether the derivative ERI's should be stored to RAM or not. Only meaningful when performing Ehrenfest MD. Memory usage is defined via MAX_MEMORY, i.e. the memory is shared wit the energy ERI's.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_memory_treat_forces_in_core

metaInfos.description: Number of shells taken into account for periodicity. By default, cp2k tries to automatically evaluate this number. This algorithm might be to conservative, resulting in some overhead. You can try to adjust this number in order to make a calculation cheaper.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_periodic_number_of_shells

metaInfos.description: Improve the performance of pw_hfx at the cost of some additional memory by storing the realspace representation of PW_HFX_BLOCKSIZE states.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_pw_hfx_blocksize

metaInfos.description: Compute the Hartree-Fock energy also in the plane wave basis.The value is ignored, and intended for debugging only.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_pw_hfx

metaInfos.description: Screens the near field part of the electronic repulsion integrals using the Schwarz inequality for the given threshold. This will be approximately the accuracy of the forces,  and should normally be similar to EPS_SCF
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_screening_eps_schwarz_forces

metaInfos.description: Screens the near field part of the electronic repulsion integrals using the Schwarz inequality for the given threshold.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_screening_eps_schwarz

metaInfos.description: Recalculates integrals on the fly if the actual density matrix is larger by a given factor than the initial one. If the factor is set to 0.0_dp, this feature is disabled.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_screening_p_screen_correction_factor

metaInfos.description: Screen on an initial density matrix. For the first MD step this matrix must be provided by a Restart File.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_screening_screen_on_initial_p

metaInfos.description: Screens the electronic repulsion integrals for the forces using the density matrix. This results in a significant speedup for large systems, but might require a somewhat tigher EPS_SCHWARZ_FORCES.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_screening_screen_p_forces

metaInfos.description: Determines how spin denisities are taken into account. If true, the beta spin density is included via a second in core call. If false, alpha and beta spins are done in one shot
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_hf_treat_lsd_in_core

metaInfos.description: The cutoff on tau used by the xc calculation
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_tau_cutoff

metaInfos.description: The cutoff of the FFT grid used in the calculation of the nonlocal vdW functional [Ry].
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_vdw_potential_non_local_cutoff

metaInfos.description: Name of the kernel data file, may include a path.vdW_kernel_table.dat is for DRSLL and LMKLL andrVV10_kernel_table.dat is for rVV10.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_vdw_potential_non_local_kernel_file_name

metaInfos.description: Parameters b and C of the rVV10 functional
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_vdw_potential_non_local_parameters

metaInfos.description: Type of functional (the corresponding kernel data file should be selected).Allows for common forms such as vdW-DF, vdW-DF2, optB88-vdW, rVV10.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_vdw_potential_non_local_type

metaInfos.description: Extensive output for non local functionals
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_vdw_potential_non_local_verbose_output

metaInfos.description: Specifies the coordination number of a set of atoms for the C9 term in DFT-D3.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_atom_coordination_numbers

metaInfos.description: Specifies parameters for atom types (in atomic units). If not provided default parameters are used (DFT-D2).
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_atomparm

metaInfos.description: Calculate C9 terms in DFT-D3 model
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_calculate_c9_term

metaInfos.description: XC Functional dependent scaling parameters (s6,sr6,s8) for the DFT-D3 method, if set to zero CP2K attempts to guess the xc functional from REFERENCE_FUNCTIONAL and sets the associated scaling parameter.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_d3_scaling

metaInfos.description: XC Functional dependent scaling parameters (s6,a1,s8,a2) for the DFT-D3(BJ) method, if set to zero CP2K attempts to guess the xc functional from REFERENCE_FUNCTIONAL and sets the associated scaling parameter.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_d3bj_scaling

metaInfos.description: Cutoff value for coordination number function (DFT-D3 method)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_eps_cn

metaInfos.description: Prefactor in exponential damping factor (DFT-D2 potential)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_exp_pre

metaInfos.description: Specifies the coordination number for a kind for the C9 term in DFT-D3.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_kind_coordination_numbers

metaInfos.description: Calculate a long range correction to the DFT-D3 model
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_long_range_correction

metaInfos.description: Name of the parameter file, may include a path
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_parameter_file_name

metaInfos.description: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with lowercase letter l) or with the iteration number. Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_print_dftd_add_last

metaInfos.description: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_print_dftd_common_iteration_levels

metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_print_dftd_filename

metaInfos.description: This keywords enables the logger for the print_key (a message is printed on screen everytime data, controlled by this print_key, are written)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_print_dftd_log_print_key

metaInfos.description: Level starting at which this proprety is printed
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_print_dftd_section_parameters

metaInfos.description: XC Functional dependent scaling parameter, if set to zero CP2K attempts to guess the xc functional that is in use and sets the associated scaling parameter.

metaInfos.description: Type of potential
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_type

metaInfos.description: Extensive output for the DFT-D2 and DFT-D3 models
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_vdw_potential_pair_potential_verbose_output

metaInfos.description: Type of dispersion/vdW functional or potential to use
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_vdw_potential_potential_type

metaInfos.description: Calculate the condition number of the (P|Q) matrix for the RI methods.

metaInfos.description: Convergence threshold for the solution of the Z-vector equations. The Z-vector equations have the form of a linear system of equations Ax=b, convergence is achieved when |Ax-b|<=EPS_CONV.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_cphf_eps_conv

metaInfos.description: Maximum number of iterations allowed for the solution of the Z-vector equations.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_cphf_max_iter

metaInfos.description: Send big messages between processes (useful for >48 processors).
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_direct_canonical_big_send

metaInfos.description: Group size used in the computation of the integrals. Default is to use all processors (GROUP_SIZE=-1).A smaller group size (for example the node size), might a better choice if the actual MP2 time is large compared to integral computation time. This is usually the case if the total number of processors is not too large.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_group_size

metaInfos.description: Which interaction potential should be used (Coulomb, TShPSC operator).
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_interaction_potential_potential_type

metaInfos.description: Determines truncation radius for the truncated TShPSC potential. Only valid when doing truncated calculation
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_interaction_potential_truncation_radius

metaInfos.description: Location of the file TShPSC.dat that contains the data for the evaluation of the TShPSC G0
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_interaction_potential_tshpsc_data

metaInfos.description: Maximum allowed total memory usage during MP2 methods [Mb].
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_memory

metaInfos.description: Which method should be used to compute the MP2 energy
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_method

metaInfos.description: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with lowercase letter l) or with the iteration number. Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_mp2_info_add_last

metaInfos.description: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_mp2_info_common_iteration_levels

metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_mp2_info_filename

metaInfos.description: This keywords enables the logger for the print_key (a message is printed on screen everytime data, controlled by this print_key, are written)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_mp2_info_log_print_key

metaInfos.description: Level starting at which this proprety is printed
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_mp2_info_section_parameters

metaInfos.description: Specifies the size of the auxiliary basis set automatically generated as initial guess. This will be effective only if RI_AUX_BASIS_SET in the KIND section and NUM_FUNC are not specified.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_opt_ri_basis_basis_size

metaInfos.description: Target accuracy in the relative deviation of the amplitudes calculated with and without RI approximation, (more details in Chem.Phys.Lett.294(1998)143).
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_opt_ri_basis_delta_i_rel

metaInfos.description: Target accuracy in the absolute difference between the RI-MP2 and the exact MP2 energy, DRI=ABS(E_MP2-E_RI-MP2).
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_opt_ri_basis_delta_ri

metaInfos.description: The derivatives of the MP2 energy with respect to the exponents of the basis are calculated numerically. The change in the exponent a_i employed for the numerical evaluation is defined as h_i=EPS_DERIV*a_i.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_opt_ri_basis_eps_deriv

metaInfos.description: Specifies the maximum number of steps in the RI basis optimization.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_opt_ri_basis_max_iter

metaInfos.description: Specifies the number of function, for each angular momentum (s, p, d ...), employed in the automatically generated initial guess. This will be effective only if RI_AUX_BASIS_SET in the KIND section is not specified.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_opt_ri_basis_num_func

metaInfos.description: Number of quadrature points for the numerical integration in the RI-SOS-MP2-Laplace method.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_laplace_quadrature_points

metaInfos.description: Group size for the integration in the Laplace method, that is the number of processes involved in the computation of each integration point. SIZE_INTEG_GROUP has to be a multiple of GROUP_SIZE in the WF_CORRELATION section. The default (-1) is automatic.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_laplace_size_integ_group

metaInfos.description: Determines the blocking used for communication in RI-MP2. Larger BLOCK_SIZE reduces communication but requires more memory. The default (-1) is automatic.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_mp2_block_size

metaInfos.description: Threshold for discriminate if a given ij pairs of the unrelaxed MP2 density matrix has to be calculated with a canonical reformulation based on the occupied eigenvalues differences.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_mp2_eps_canonical

metaInfos.description: Free the buffer containing the 4 center integrals used in the Hartree-Fock exchange calculation. This will be effective only for gradients calculations, since for the energy only case, the buffers are released by default. (Right now debugging only).
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_mp2_free_hfx_buffer

metaInfos.description: The fraction of Hartree-Fock to add to the total energy. 1.0 implies standard Hartree-Fock if used with XC_FUNCTIONAL NONE. NOTE: In a mixed potential calculation this should be set to 1.0, otherwise all parts are multiplied with this factor.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_fraction

metaInfos.description: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with lowercase letter l) or with the iteration number. Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_hf_info_add_last

metaInfos.description: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_hf_info_common_iteration_levels

metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_hf_info_filename

metaInfos.description: This keywords enables the logger for the print_key (a message is printed on screen everytime data, controlled by this print_key, are written)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_hf_info_log_print_key

metaInfos.description: Level starting at which this proprety is printed
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_hf_info_section_parameters

metaInfos.description: Accuracy of iterative RI fit
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_hfx_ri_eps_optimization

metaInfos.description: Accuracy of geminal integral evaluation
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_hfx_ri_eps_screening

metaInfos.description: Maximum number of iteration in RI fit
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_hfx_ri_max_iter

metaInfos.description: Determines cutoff radius for the truncated 1/r potential. Only valid when doing truncated calculation
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_interaction_potential_cutoff_radius

metaInfos.description: Parameter for short/longrange interaction
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_interaction_potential_omega

metaInfos.description: Which interaction potential should be used (Coulomb, longrange or shortrange).
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_interaction_potential_potential_type

metaInfos.description: Scales Hartree-Fock contribution arising from a coulomb potential. Only valid when doing a mixed potential calculation
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_interaction_potential_scale_coulomb

metaInfos.description: Scales Hartree-Fock contribution arising from a gaussian potential. Only valid when doing a mixed potential calculation
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_interaction_potential_scale_gaussian

metaInfos.description: Scales Hartree-Fock contribution arising from a longrange potential. Only valid when doing a mixed potential calculation
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_interaction_potential_scale_longrange

metaInfos.description: Location of the file t_c_g.dat that contains the data for the evaluation of the truncated gamma function
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_interaction_potential_t_c_g_data

metaInfos.description: Determines the blocking used for the atomic quartet loops. A proper choice can speedup the calculation. The default (-1) is automatic.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_load_balance_block_size

metaInfos.description: Number of bins per process used to group atom quartets.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_load_balance_nbins

metaInfos.description: This flag controls the randomization of the bin assignment to processes. For highly ordered input structures with a bad load balance, setting this flag to TRUE might improve.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_load_balance_randomize

metaInfos.description: Scaling factor to scale eps_schwarz. Storage threshold for compression will be EPS_SCHWARZ*EPS_STORAGE_SCALING.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_memory_eps_storage_scaling

metaInfos.description: Defines the maximum amount of disk space [MB] used to store precomputed compressed four-center integrals. If 0, nothing is stored to disk
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_memory_max_disk_space

metaInfos.description: Defines the maximum amount of memory [MB] to be consumed by the full HFX module. All temporary buffers and helper arrays are subtracted from this number. What remains will be used for storage of integrals. NOTE: This number is assumed to represent the memory available to one MPI process. When running a threaded version, cp2k automatically takes care of distributing the memory among all the threads within a process.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_memory_max_memory

metaInfos.description: Loaction where ERI's are stored if MAX_DISK_SPACE /=0 Expects a path to a directory.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_memory_storage_location

metaInfos.description: Determines whether the derivative ERI's should be stored to RAM or not. Only meaningful when performing Ehrenfest MD. Memory usage is defined via MAX_MEMORY, i.e. the memory is shared wit the energy ERI's.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_memory_treat_forces_in_core

metaInfos.description: Number of shells taken into account for periodicity. By default, cp2k tries to automatically evaluate this number. This algorithm might be to conservative, resulting in some overhead. You can try to adjust this number in order to make a calculation cheaper.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_periodic_number_of_shells

metaInfos.description: Improve the performance of pw_hfx at the cost of some additional memory by storing the realspace representation of PW_HFX_BLOCKSIZE states.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_pw_hfx_blocksize

metaInfos.description: Compute the Hartree-Fock energy also in the plane wave basis.The value is ignored, and intended for debugging only.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_pw_hfx

metaInfos.description: Screens the near field part of the electronic repulsion integrals using the Schwarz inequality for the given threshold. This will be approximately the accuracy of the forces,  and should normally be similar to EPS_SCF
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_screening_eps_schwarz_forces

metaInfos.description: Screens the near field part of the electronic repulsion integrals using the Schwarz inequality for the given threshold.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_screening_eps_schwarz

metaInfos.description: Recalculates integrals on the fly if the actual density matrix is larger by a given factor than the initial one. If the factor is set to 0.0_dp, this feature is disabled.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_screening_p_screen_correction_factor

metaInfos.description: Screen on an initial density matrix. For the first MD step this matrix must be provided by a Restart File.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_screening_screen_on_initial_p

metaInfos.description: Screens the electronic repulsion integrals for the forces using the density matrix. This results in a significant speedup for large systems, but might require a somewhat tigher EPS_SCHWARZ_FORCES.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_screening_screen_p_forces

metaInfos.description: Determines how spin denisities are taken into account. If true, the beta spin density is included via a second in core call. If false, alpha and beta spins are done in one shot
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_hf_treat_lsd_in_core

metaInfos.description: Use the Minimax quadrature scheme for performing the numerical integration. Maximum number of quadrature point limited to 20.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_minimax_quadrature

metaInfos.description: Matrix multiplication style for the Q matrix.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_mm_style

metaInfos.description: Number of quadrature points for the numerical integration in the RI-RPA method.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_quadrature_points

metaInfos.description: Group size for frequency integration, that is the number of processes involved in the computation of each integration point. SIZE_FREQ_INTEG_GROUP has to be a multiple of GROUP_SIZE in the WF_CORRELATION section. The default (-1) is automatic.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_ri_rpa_size_freq_integ_group

metaInfos.description: Size of the row block used in the SCALAPACK block cyclic data distribution.Default is (ROW_BLOCK=-1) is automatic. A proper choice can speedup the parallel matrix multiplication in the case of RI-RPA and RI-SOS-MP2-Laplace.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_row_block

metaInfos.description: Scaling factor of the singlet energy component (opposite spin, OS).
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_scale_s

metaInfos.description: Scaling factor of the triplet energy component (same spin, SS).
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_dft_xc_wf_correlation_scale_t

metaInfos.description: The cutoff of the finest grid level in the MP2 gpw integration.

metaInfos.description: Determines a threshold for the DBCSR based multiply (usually 10 times smaller than EPS_GRID).

metaInfos.description: Determines a threshold for the GPW based integration

metaInfos.description: How much output is written by the individual groups.

metaInfos.description: Specifies the filename that contains the tabulated EAM potential. File structure: the first line of the potential file contains a title. The second line contains: atomic number, mass and lattice constant. These information are parsed but not used in CP2K. The third line contains: dr: increment of r for the tabulated values of density and phi (assuming r starts in 0) [angstrom]; drho: increment of density for the tabulated values of the embedding function (assuming rho starts in 0) [au_c]; cutoff: cutoff of the EAM potential; npoints: number of points in tabulated. Follow in order npoints lines for rho [au_c] and its derivative [au_c*angstrom^-1]; npoints lines for PHI [ev] and its derivative [ev*angstrom^-1] and npoint lines for the embedded function [ev] and its derivative [ev*au_c^-1].
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded_eam_parm_file_name
