metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_shell_k2_spring

metaInfos.description: Force constant k4 of the spring potential 1/2*k2*r^2 + 1/24*k4*r^4 binding a core-shell pair when a core-shell potential is employed. By default a harmonic spring potential is used, i.e. k4 is zero.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_shell_k4_spring

metaInfos.description: Fraction of the mass of the atom to be assigned to the shell
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_shell_mass_fraction

metaInfos.description: Assign a maximum elongation of the spring, if negative no limit is imposed
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_shell_max_distance

metaInfos.description: The kind for which the shell potential parameters are given
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_shell_section_parameters

metaInfos.description: Partial charge assigned to the shell (electron charge units)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_shell_shell_charge

metaInfos.description: Define a screening function to exclude some neighbors  of the shell when electrostatic interaction are considered, if negative no screening is operated
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_shell_shell_cutoff

metaInfos.description: Add a constant energy shift to the real-space non-bonding interactions (both Van der Waals and electrostatic) such that the energy at the cutoff radius is zero. This makes the non-bonding interactions continuous at the cutoff.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_shift_cutoff

metaInfos.description: Specify the maximum value of energy used to check the accuracy requested through EPS_SPLINE. Energy values larger than EMAX_ACCURACY generally do not  satisfy the requested accuracy
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_spline_emax_accuracy

metaInfos.description: Specify the maximum value of the potential up to which splines will be constructed
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_spline_emax_spline

metaInfos.description: Specify the threshold for the choice of the number of points used in the splines (comparing the splined value with the  analytically evaluated one)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_spline_eps_spline

metaInfos.description: Override the default search for an accurate spline by specifying a fixed number of spline points.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_spline_npoints

metaInfos.description: Specify the minimum value of the distance interval  that brackets the value of emax_spline.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_spline_r0_nb

metaInfos.description: Cutoff radius for nonbonded interactions. This value overrides  the value specified in the potential definition and is global for all potentials.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_spline_rcut_nb

metaInfos.description: For few potentials (Lennard-Jones) one global optimal spline is generated instead of different optimal splines for each kind of potential
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_spline_unique_spline

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_torsion_phi0

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_vdw_scale14

metaInfos.description: A short range repulsive potential is added, to simulate collisions and scattering.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_zbl_scattering

metaInfos.description: This keyword enables the check that two atoms are never below the minimum value used to construct the splines during the construction of the neighbouring list. Disabling this keyword avoids CP2K to abort in case two atoms are below the minimum  value of the radius used to generate the splines.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_neighbor_lists_geo_check

metaInfos.description: This keyword enables the building of the neighbouring list from scratch.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_neighbor_lists_neighbor_lists_from_scratch

metaInfos.description: Defines the Verlet Skin for the generation of the neighbor lists
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_neighbor_lists_verlet_skin

metaInfos.description: alpha parameter associated with Ewald (EWALD|PME|SPME). Recommended for small systems is is alpha = 3.5 / r_cut. Tuning alpha, r_cut and gmax is needed to obtain O(N**1.5) scaling for ewald.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_ewald_alpha

metaInfos.description: tolerance of gaussians for fft interpolation (PME only)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_ewald_epsilon

metaInfos.description: Expected accuracy in the Ewald sum. This number affects only the calculation of the cutoff for the real-space term of the ewald summation (EWALD|PME|SPME) as well as the construction of the neighbor lists (if the cutoff for non-bonded terms is smaller than the value employed to compute the EWALD real-space term). This keyword has no effect on the reciprocal space term (which can be tuned independently).
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_ewald_ewald_accuracy

metaInfos.description: The type of ewald you want to perform.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_ewald_ewald_type

metaInfos.description: number of grid points (SPME and EWALD). If a single number is specified,the same number of points is used for all three directions on the grid.If three numbers are given, each direction can have a different number of points.The number of points needs to be FFTable (which depends on the library used) and odd for EWALD.The optimal number depends e.g. on alpha and the size of the cell. 1 point per Angstrom is common.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_ewald_gmax

metaInfos.description: Specify the rmsd threshold for the derivatives of the energy towards the Cartesian dipoles components
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_ewald_multipoles_eps_pol

metaInfos.description: Specify the maximum number of iterations for induced dipoles
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_ewald_multipoles_max_ipol_iter

metaInfos.description: Specify the maximum level of multipoles expansion used  for the electrostatics.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_ewald_multipoles_max_multipole_expansion

metaInfos.description: Specify the method to obtain self consistent induced multipole moments.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_ewald_multipoles_pol_scf

metaInfos.description: Controls the activation of the Multipoles
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_ewald_multipoles_section_parameters

metaInfos.description: number of grid points on small mesh (PME only), should be odd.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_ewald_ns_max

metaInfos.description: order of the beta-Euler spline (SPME only)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_ewald_o_spline

metaInfos.description: Explicitly provide the real-space cutoff of the ewald summation (EWALD|PME|SPME). If present, overwrites the estimate of EWALD_ACCURACY and may affect the construction of the neighbor lists for non-bonded terms (in FIST), if the value specified is larger than the cutoff for non-bonded interactions.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_ewald_rcut

metaInfos.description: Specifies the number of slices in the x, y and z directions.-1 specifies that any number of slices is OK.If a given distribution can not be satisfied, a replicated grid will result.Also see LOCK_DISTRIBUTION.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_ewald_rs_grid_distribution_layout

metaInfos.description: Parallelization strategy.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_ewald_rs_grid_distribution_type

metaInfos.description: Can be used to reduce the halo of the distributed grid (experimental features).
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_ewald_rs_grid_halo_reduction_factor

metaInfos.description: Expert use only, only basic QS deals correctly with a non-default value.If the distribution is locked, a grid will have the same distribution asthe next finer multigrid (provided it is distributed).If unlocked, all grids can be distributed freely.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_ewald_rs_grid_lock_distribution

metaInfos.description: If the multigrid-level of a grid is larger than the parameter, it will not be distributed in the automatic scheme.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_ewald_rs_grid_max_distributed_level

metaInfos.description: A grid will only be distributed if the memory usage for that grid (including halo) is smaller than a replicated grid by this parameter.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_ewald_rs_grid_memory_factor

metaInfos.description: Convergence parameter ALPHA*RMIN. Default value 7.0
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_mt_alpha

metaInfos.description: Specify the multiplicative factor for the CUTOFF keyword in MULTI_GRID  section. The result gives the cutoff at which the 1/r non-periodic FFT3D is evaluated.Default is 2.0
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_mt_rel_cutoff

metaInfos.description: Evaluates the Gterm in the Ewald Scheme analytically instead of using Splines.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_multipole_analytical_gterm

metaInfos.description: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with lowercase letter l) or with the iteration number. Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_multipole_check_spline_add_last

metaInfos.description: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_multipole_check_spline_common_iteration_levels

metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_mm_poisson_multipole_check_spline_filename

metaInfos.description: Specifies the list of indexes of atoms used to define the region for the RESP fitting. The list should contain indexes of atoms of the first surface layer.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_properties_resp_periodic_sys_atom_list

metaInfos.description: Length of the sampling box, i.e. a box of this length and the height specified by RANGE is defined above each surface atom given in ATOM_LIST. The grid points in the boxes are accepted as fitting point. Should be in the range of the nearest neighbour distance (a bit larger to be on the safe side). Allows for a refined sampling of grid points in case of corrugated surfaces.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_properties_resp_periodic_sys_length

metaInfos.description: Range where the fitting points are sampled. A range of 3 to 5 Angstroms means that the fitting points are sampled in the region of 3 to 5 Angstroms above the surface which is defined by atom indexes given in ATOM_LIST.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_properties_resp_periodic_sys_range

metaInfos.description: Specifies what above the surface means. Defines the direction.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_properties_resp_periodic_sys_surf_direction

metaInfos.description: If defined, enforce the restraint of non-hydrogen atoms to zero. Its value is the strength of the restraint on the heavy atoms.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_properties_resp_restrain_heavies_strength

metaInfos.description: Restrain non-hydrogen atoms to zero.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_properties_resp_restrain_heavies_to_zero

metaInfos.description: Defines the coefficient of the atom in this linear restraint. If given, the restraint will be: s*(sum over atom_list c_i * q_i - t)**2
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_properties_resp_restraint_atom_coef

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_properties_resp_restraint_atom_list

metaInfos.description: the target value for the constraint
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_properties_resp_restraint_strength

metaInfos.description: the target value for the restraint
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_properties_resp_restraint_target

metaInfos.description: The stride (X,Y,Z) used to write the cube file (larger values result in smaller cube files). You can provide 3 numbers (for X,Y,Z) or 1 number valid for all components.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_properties_resp_stride

metaInfos.description: Specifies the value of the width of the Gaussian charge distribution carried by each atom. Needs only to be specified when using a periodic Poisson solver.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_properties_resp_width

metaInfos.description: Specify the lengths of the cell vectors A, B, and C, which defines the diagonal elements of h matrix for an orthorhombic cell. For non-orthorhombic cells it is possible either to specify the angles ALPHA, BETA, GAMMA via ALPHA_BETA_GAMMA keyword or alternatively use the keywords A, B, and C. The convention is that A lies along the X-axis, B is in the XY plane.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_cell_abc

metaInfos.description: Specify the angles between the vectors A, B and C when using the ABC keyword. The convention is that A lies along the X-axis, B is in the XY plane. ALPHA is the angle between B and C, BETA is the angle between A and C and GAMMA the angle between A and B.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_cell_alpha_beta_gamma

metaInfos.description: Specify the Cartesian components for the cell vector A. This defines the first column of the h matrix.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_cell_a

metaInfos.description: Specify the Cartesian components for the cell vector B. This defines the second column of the h matrix.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_cell_b

metaInfos.description: Specify the format of the cell file (if used)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_cell_cell_file_format

metaInfos.description: Possibility to read the cell from an external file
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_cell_cell_file_name

The convention is that A lies along the X-axis, B is in the XY plane.

metaInfos.description: Specify the angles between the vectors A, B and C when using the ABC keyword. The convention is that A lies along the X-axis, B is in the XY plane. ALPHA is the angle between B and C, BETA is the angle between A and C and GAMMA the angle between A and B.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_cell_cell_ref_alpha_beta_gamma

metaInfos.description: Specifies the numbers of repetition in space (X, Y, Z) of the defined cell, assuming it as a unit cell. This keyword affects only the CELL specification. The same keyword in SUBSYS%TOPOLOGY%MULTIPLE_UNIT_CELL should be modified in order to affect the coordinates specification.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_cell_cell_ref_multiple_unit_cell

metaInfos.description: Specify the directions for which periodic boundary conditions (PBC) will be applied. Important notice: This applies to the generation of the pair lists as well as to the application of the PBCs to positions. See the POISSON section to specify the periodicity used for the electrostatics. Typically the settings should be the same.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_cell_cell_ref_periodic

metaInfos.description: Imposes an initial cell symmetry.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_cell_cell_ref_symmetry

The same keyword in SUBSYS%TOPOLOGY%MULTIPLE_UNIT_CELL should be modified in order to affect the coordinates specification.

metaInfos.description: Real space cutoff for the Ewald sum.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_multipole_rcut

metaInfos.description: Defines the usage of the multipole section
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_multipole_section_parameters

metaInfos.description: Specifies the number of grid points used for the Interpolation of the G-space term
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_ngrids

metaInfos.description: alpha parameter associated with Ewald (EWALD|PME|SPME). Recommended for small systems is is alpha = 3.5 / r_cut. Tuning alpha, r_cut and gmax is needed to obtain O(N**1.5) scaling for ewald.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_alpha

metaInfos.description: tolerance of gaussians for fft interpolation (PME only)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_epsilon

metaInfos.description: Expected accuracy in the Ewald sum. This number affects only the calculation of the cutoff for the real-space term of the ewald summation (EWALD|PME|SPME) as well as the construction of the neighbor lists (if the cutoff for non-bonded terms is smaller than the value employed to compute the EWALD real-space term). This keyword has no effect on the reciprocal space term (which can be tuned independently).
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_ewald_accuracy

metaInfos.description: The type of ewald you want to perform.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_ewald_type

metaInfos.description: number of grid points (SPME and EWALD). If a single number is specified,the same number of points is used for all three directions on the grid.If three numbers are given, each direction can have a different number of points.The number of points needs to be FFTable (which depends on the library used) and odd for EWALD.The optimal number depends e.g. on alpha and the size of the cell. 1 point per Angstrom is common.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_gmax

metaInfos.description: Specify the rmsd threshold for the derivatives of the energy towards the Cartesian dipoles components
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_multipoles_eps_pol

metaInfos.description: Specify the maximum number of iterations for induced dipoles
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_multipoles_max_ipol_iter

metaInfos.description: Specify the maximum level of multipoles expansion used  for the electrostatics.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_multipoles_max_multipole_expansion

metaInfos.description: Specify the method to obtain self consistent induced multipole moments.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_multipoles_pol_scf

metaInfos.description: Controls the activation of the Multipoles
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_multipoles_section_parameters

metaInfos.description: number of grid points on small mesh (PME only), should be odd.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_ns_max

metaInfos.description: order of the beta-Euler spline (SPME only)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_o_spline

metaInfos.description: Explicitly provide the real-space cutoff of the ewald summation (EWALD|PME|SPME). If present, overwrites the estimate of EWALD_ACCURACY and may affect the construction of the neighbor lists for non-bonded terms (in FIST), if the value specified is larger than the cutoff for non-bonded interactions.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_rcut

metaInfos.description: Specifies the number of slices in the x, y and z directions.-1 specifies that any number of slices is OK.If a given distribution can not be satisfied, a replicated grid will result.Also see LOCK_DISTRIBUTION.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_rs_grid_distribution_layout

metaInfos.description: Parallelization strategy.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_rs_grid_distribution_type

metaInfos.description: Can be used to reduce the halo of the distributed grid (experimental features).
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_rs_grid_halo_reduction_factor

metaInfos.description: Expert use only, only basic QS deals correctly with a non-default value.If the distribution is locked, a grid will have the same distribution asthe next finer multigrid (provided it is distributed).If unlocked, all grids can be distributed freely.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_rs_grid_lock_distribution

metaInfos.description: If the multigrid-level of a grid is larger than the parameter, it will not be distributed in the automatic scheme.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_rs_grid_max_distributed_level

metaInfos.description: A grid will only be distributed if the memory usage for that grid (including halo) is smaller than a replicated grid by this parameter.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_ewald_rs_grid_memory_factor

metaInfos.description: Convergence parameter ALPHA*RMIN. Default value 7.0
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_mt_alpha

metaInfos.description: Specify the multiplicative factor for the CUTOFF keyword in MULTI_GRID  section. The result gives the cutoff at which the 1/r non-periodic FFT3D is evaluated.Default is 2.0
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_mt_rel_cutoff

metaInfos.description: Evaluates the Gterm in the Ewald Scheme analytically instead of using Splines.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_multipole_analytical_gterm

metaInfos.description: Real space cutoff for the Ewald sum.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_multipole_rcut

metaInfos.description: Specify the directions on wich apply PBC. Important notice,  this only applies to the electrostatics. See the CELL section to specify the periodicity used for e.g. the pair lists. Typically the settings should be the same.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_periodic

metaInfos.description: Specify which kind of solver to use to solve the Poisson equation.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_poisson_solver

metaInfos.description: Type of scaling function used in the wavelet approach, the total energy depends on this choice,and the convergence with respect to cutoff depends on the selected scaling functions.Possible values are 8,14,16,20,24,30,40,50,60,100
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_poisson_wavelet_scf_type

metaInfos.description: Specifies the number of replica to take into consideration for the real part of the calculation. Default is letting the qmmm module decide how many replica you really need.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_periodic_replica

metaInfos.description: The indexes of the mm atoms that have this kind. This keyword can be repeated several times (useful if you have to specify many indexes).
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_qm_kind_mm_index

metaInfos.description: The qm kind
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_qm_kind_section_parameters

metaInfos.description: Set the spherical cutoff for the QMMM electrostatic interaction. This acts like a charge multiplicative factor dependent on cutoff. For MM atoms farther than the SPHERICAL_CUTOFF(1) their charge is zero. The switch is performed with a smooth function: 0.5*(1-TANH((r-[SPH_CUT(1)-20*SPH_CUT(2)])/(SPH_CUT(2)))). Two values are required: the first one is the distance cutoff. The second one controls the stiffness of the smoothing.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_spherical_cutoff

metaInfos.description: This keyword enables the use of the internal GEEP library to generate the gaussian expansion of the MM potential. Using this keyword there's no need to provide the MM_POTENTIAL_FILENAME. It expects a number from 2 to 15 (the number of gaussian funtions to be used in the expansion.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_use_geep_lib

metaInfos.description: Specify the value of the the force constant for the quadratic wall
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_walls_k

metaInfos.description: Specifies the type of wall
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_walls_type

metaInfos.description: Specify the value of the skin of the Wall in each dimension. The wall's effect is felt when atoms fall within the skin of the Wall.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_qmmm_walls_wall_skin

metaInfos.description: Specify the Maximum Values of the force. If the force of one atom exceed this value it's rescaled to the MAX_FORCE value.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_rescale_forces_max_force

metaInfos.description: Controls the calculation of the stress tensor. The combinations defined below are not implemented for all methods.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_stress_tensor

metaInfos.description: Specify the lengths of the cell vectors A, B, and C, which defines the diagonal elements of h matrix for an orthorhombic cell. For non-orthorhombic cells it is possible either to specify the angles ALPHA, BETA, GAMMA via ALPHA_BETA_GAMMA keyword or alternatively use the keywords A, B, and C. The convention is that A lies along the X-axis, B is in the XY plane.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_abc

metaInfos.description: Specify the angles between the vectors A, B and C when using the ABC keyword. The convention is that A lies along the X-axis, B is in the XY plane. ALPHA is the angle between B and C, BETA is the angle between A and C and GAMMA the angle between A and B.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_alpha_beta_gamma

metaInfos.description: Specify the Cartesian components for the cell vector A. This defines the first column of the h matrix.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_a

metaInfos.description: Specify the Cartesian components for the cell vector B. This defines the second column of the h matrix.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_b

metaInfos.description: Specify the format of the cell file (if used)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_cell_file_format

metaInfos.description: Possibility to read the cell from an external file
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_cell_file_name

metaInfos.description: Specify the lengths of the cell vectors A, B, and C, which defines the diagonal elements of h matrix for an orthorhombic cell. For non-orthorhombic cells it is possible either to specify the angles ALPHA, BETA, GAMMA via ALPHA_BETA_GAMMA keyword or alternatively use the keywords A, B, and C. The convention is that A lies along the X-axis, B is in the XY plane.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_cell_ref_abc

metaInfos.description: Specify the angles between the vectors A, B and C when using the ABC keyword. The convention is that A lies along the X-axis, B is in the XY plane. ALPHA is the angle between B and C, BETA is the angle between A and C and GAMMA the angle between A and B.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_cell_ref_alpha_beta_gamma

metaInfos.description: Specify the Cartesian components for the cell vector A. This defines the first column of the h matrix.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_cell_ref_a

metaInfos.description: Specify the Cartesian components for the cell vector B. This defines the second column of the h matrix.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_cell_ref_b

metaInfos.description: Specify the format of the cell file (if used)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_cell_ref_cell_file_format

metaInfos.description: Possibility to read the cell from an external file
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_cell_ref_cell_file_name

metaInfos.description: Specify the Cartesian components for the cell vector C. This defines the third column of the h matrix.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_cell_ref_c

metaInfos.description: Specifies the numbers of repetition in space (X, Y, Z) of the defined cell, assuming it as a unit cell. This keyword affects only the CELL specification. The same keyword in SUBSYS%TOPOLOGY%MULTIPLE_UNIT_CELL should be modified in order to affect the coordinates specification.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_cell_cell_ref_multiple_unit_cell

metaInfos.description: Specify the directions for which periodic boundary conditions (PBC) will be applied. metaInfos.description: Specifies the ith element of the vector valued function that defines the reaction path. This keyword needs to repeat exactly Q times, and the order must match the order of the colvars. The VARIABLE (e.g. T) which parametrises the curve can be used as the target of a constraint.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_colvar_distance_from_path_function

metaInfos.description: Specifies the exponent of the Gaussian used in the integral representation of the colvar.The shape of the space orthogonal to the reaction path is defined by this choice. In the limit of large values, it is given by the plane orthogonal to the path.In practice, modest values are required for stable numerical integration.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_colvar_distance_from_path_lambda

metaInfos.description: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with lowercase letter l) or with the iteration number. Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_colvar_distance_from_path_map_add_last

metaInfos.description: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)

metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_colvar_distance_from_path_map_filename

metaInfos.description: Specifies the ith element of the vector valued function that defines the reaction path. This keyword needs to repeat exactly Q times, and the order must match the order of the colvars. The VARIABLE (e.g. T) which parametrises the curve can be used as the target of a constraint.

metaInfos.description: Specifies the exponent of the Gaussian used in the integral representation of the colvar.The shape of the space orthogonal to the reaction path is defined by this choice. In the limit of large values, it is given by the plane orthogonal to the path.In practice, modest values are required for stable numerical integration.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_colvar_reaction_path_lambda

metaInfos.description: If the last iteration should be added, and if it should be marked symbolically (with lowercase letter l) or with the iteration number. Not every iteration level is able to identify the last iteration early enough to be able to output. When this keyword is activated all iteration levels are checked for the last iteration step.

metaInfos.description: How many iterations levels should be written in the same file (no extra information about the actual iteration level is written to the file)

metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. A middle name (if present), iteration numbers and extension are always added to the filename. if you want to avoid it use =filename, in this case the filename is always exactly as typed. Please note that this can lead to clashes of filenames.

metaInfos.description:
CP2K Basis Set Standard Format 
Element symbol  Name of the basis set  Alias names
nset (repeat the following block of lines nset times)
n lmin lmax nexp nshell(lmin) nshell(lmin+1) ... nshell(lmax-1) nshell(lmax)
a(1)      c(1,l,1)      c(1,l,2) ...      c(1,l,nshell(l)-1)      c(1,l,nshell(l)), l=lmin,lmax
a(2)      c(2,l,1)      c(2,l,2) ...      c(2,l,nshell(l)-1)      c(2,l,nshell(l)), l=lmin,lmax
 .         .             .                 .                       .
 .         .             .                 .                       .
 .         .             .                 .                       .
a(nexp-1) c(nexp-1,l,1) c(nexp-1,l,2) ... c(nexp-1,l,nshell(l)-1) c(nexp-1,l,nshell(l)), l=lmin,lmax
a(nexp)   c(nexp,l,1)   c(nexp,l,2)   ... c(nexp,l,nshell(l)-1)   c(nexp,l,nshell(l)), l=lmin,lmax


nset     : Number of exponent sets
n        : Principle quantum number (only for orbital label printing)
lmax     : Maximum angular momentum quantum number l
lmin     : Minimum angular momentum quantum number l
nshell(l): Number of shells for angular momentum quantum number l
a        : Exponent
c        : Contraction coefficient
Source: ftp://ftp.aip.org/epaps/journ_chem_phys/E-JCPSA6-127-308733/BASIS_MOLOPT_JCP.txt
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_kind_basis_default_keyword

metaInfos.description: Defines the radius of the electrostatic multipole of the atom in Fist. This radius applies to the charge, the dipole and the quadrupole. When zero, the atom is treated as a point multipole, otherwise it is treated as a Gaussian charge distribution with the given radius: p(x,y,z)*N*exp(-(x**2+y**2+z**2)/(2*MM_RADIUS**2)), where N is a normalization constant. In the core-shell model, only the shell is treated as a Gaussian and the core is always a point charge.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_kind_mm_radius

metaInfos.description: When True, the exclude lists are solely based on the bond data in the topology. The (minimal) number of bonds between two atoms is used to determine if the atom pair is added to an exclusion list. When False, 1-2 exclusion is based on bonds in the topology, 1-3 exclusion is based on bonds and bends in the topology, 1-4 exclusion is based on bonds, bends and dihedrals in the topology. This implies that a missing dihedral in the topology will cause the corresponding 1-4 pair not to be in the exclusion list, in case 1-4 exclusion is requested for VDW or EI interactions.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_force_eval_subsys_topology_autogen_exclude_lists

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_dbcsr_use_comm_thread

metaInfos.description: Allow use of MPI-allocated memory for potentially faster network communication.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_dbcsr_use_mpi_allocation

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_echo_all_hosts

metaInfos.description: If the input should be echoed to the output with all the defaults made explicit
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_echo_input

metaInfos.description: This keywords enables the usage of unsupported features in a release version. It affects ONLY release versions of CP2K (no effects on development versions).
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_enable_unsupported_features

metaInfos.description: Use fft library specific values for the allows number of points in FFTs. The default is to use the internal FFT lengths. For external fft libraries this may create an error at the external library level, because the length provided by cp2k is not supported by the external library. In this case switch on this keyword to obtain, with certain fft libraries, lengths matching the external fft library lengths, or larger allowed grids, or grids that more precisely match a given cutoff. IMPORTANT NOTE: in this case, the actual grids used in CP2K depends on the FFT library. A change of FFT library must therefore be considered equivalent to a change of basis, which implies a change of total energy.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_extended_fft_lengths

metaInfos.description: Limits the memory usage of the FFT scratch pool, potentially reducing efficiency a bit
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_fft_pool_scratch_limit

metaInfos.description: FFTW can have improved performance if it is allowed to plan with explicit measurements which strategy is best for a given FFT. While a plan based on measurements is generally faster, differences in machine load will lead to different plans for the same input file, and thus numerics for the FFTs will be slightly different from run to run.PATIENT planning is recommended for long ab initio MD runs.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_fftw_plan_type

metaInfos.description: The name of the file that contains wisdom (pre-planned FFTs) for use with FFTW3. Using wisdom can significantly speed up the FFTs (see the FFTW homepage for details). Note that wisdom is not transferable between different computer (architectures). Wisdom can be generated using the fftw-wisdom tool that is part of the fftw installation. cp2k/tools/cp2k-wisdom is a script that contains some additional info, and can help to generate a useful default for /etc/fftw/wisdom or particular values for a given simulation.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_fftw_wisdom_file_name

metaInfos.description: Flush output regularly, enabling this option might degrade performance significantly on certain machines.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_flush_should_flush

metaInfos.description: Ensure for small matrices that the layout is compatible with bigger ones, i.e. no subdivision is performed (can break LAPACK!!!).
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_fm_force_block_size

metaInfos.description: Defines the number of columns per scalapack block in the creation of vlock cyclic dense matrices
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_fm_ncol_blocks

metaInfos.description: Defines the number of rows per scalapack block in the creation of block cyclic dense matrices
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_fm_nrow_blocks

metaInfos.description: Allows to switch between scalapack pdgemm and dbcsr_multiply. On normal systems pdgemm is recommended on system with GPU is optimized and can give better performance. NOTE: if DBCSR is employed FORCE_BLOCK_SIZE should be set. The perfomance on GPU's dependes crucially on the BLOCK_SIZES. Make sure optimized kernels are available.

metaInfos.description: Name of the output file. Relevant only if automatically started (through farming for example). If empty uses the project name as basis for it.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_output_file_name

metaInfos.description: Specifies the DIAGONALIZATION library. If not availabe ....
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_preferred_diag_library

metaInfos.description: Specifies the FFT library which should be preferred. If it is not available, use FFTW3 if this is linked in, if FFTW3 is not available use FFTSG. Improved performance with FFTW3 can be obtained specifying a proper value for FFTW_PLAN_TYPE. Contrary to earlier CP2K versions, all libraries will result in the same grids, i.e. the subset of grids which all FFT libraries can transform. See EXTENDED_FFT_LENGTHS if larger FFTs or grids that more precisely match a given cutoff are needed, or older results need to be reproduced. FFTW3 is often (close to) optimal, and well tested with CP2K.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_preferred_fft_library

metaInfos.description: How much output is written out.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_global_print_level

metaInfos.description: Which program should be run

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_bfgs_restart_file_name

metaInfos.description: Controls the reading of the initial Hessian from file.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_bfgs_restart_hessian

metaInfos.description: Trust radius used in BFGS. Previously set to 0.1. Large values can lead to instabilities
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_bfgs_trust_radius

metaInfos.description: Uses a model Hessian as initial guess instead of a unit matrix. Should lead in general to improved convergence might be switched off for exotic cases
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_bfgs_use_model_hessian

metaInfos.description: Includes a rational function optimization to determine the step. Previously default but did not improve convergence in many cases
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_bfgs_use_rat_fun_opt

metaInfos.description: Uses FLETCHER-REEVES instead of POLAK-RIBIERE when using Conjugate Gradients
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_cg_fletcher_reeves

metaInfos.description: Use only the gradient, not the energy for line minimizations (e.g. in conjugate gradients).
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_cg_line_search_2pnt_linmin_grad_only

metaInfos.description: Max allowed value for the line search step.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_cg_line_search_2pnt_max_allowed_step

metaInfos.description: Limit in 1D bracketing during line search in Conjugate Gradients Optimization.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_cg_line_search_gold_brack_limit

metaInfos.description: Maximum number of iterations in brent algorithm (used for the line search in Conjugated Gradients Optimization)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_cg_line_search_gold_brent_max_iter

metaInfos.description: Tolerance requested during Brent line search in Conjugate Gradients Optimization.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_cg_line_search_gold_brent_tol

metaInfos.description: Initial step size used, e.g. for bracketing or minimizers. Might need to be reduced for systems with close contacts
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_cg_line_search_gold_initial_step

metaInfos.description: 1D line search algorithm to be used with the CG optimizer, in increasing order of robustness and cost.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_cg_line_search_type

metaInfos.description: Maximum number of steepest descent steps before starting the conjugate gradients optimization.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_cg_max_steep_steps

metaInfos.description: Cosine of the angle between two consecutive searching directions. If the angle during a CG optimization is less than the one corresponding to  to the RESTART_LIMIT the CG is reset and one step of steepest descent is  performed.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_cg_restart_limit

metaInfos.description: Specifies the external pressure (1 value or the full 9 components of the pressure tensor) applied during the cell optimization.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_external_pressure

metaInfos.description: Keep angles between the cell vectors constant, but allow the lenghts of the cell vectors to change independently. Albeit general, this is most useful for triclinic cells, to enforce higher symmetry, see KEEP_SYMMETRY.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_keep_angles

metaInfos.description: Keep the requested initial cell symmetry (e.g. during a cell optimisation). The initial symmetry must be specified in the &CELL section.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_keep_symmetry

metaInfos.description: Maximum number of force evaluations per iteration(used for the line search)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_cell_opt_lbfgs_max_f_per_iter

metaInfos.description: Maximum rank (and consequently size) of the approximate Hessian matrix used by the LBFGS optimizer. Larger values (e.g. 30) will accelerate the convergence behaviour at the cost of a larger memory consumption.

metaInfos.description: By setting this variable larger than 0 the tail of the Gaussian hill  is damped to zero faster. The Gaussian function is multiplied by a cutoff function that becomes active at |x-X0|>HILL_TAIL_CUTOFF*SCALE, where X0 is the location of the Gaussian and SCALE is the width of the Gaussian. For more than one METAVAR X0 and SCALE are METAVAR-dependent.  (1-(|x-X0|/HILL_TAIL_CUTOFF*SCALE)^P_EXP)/(1-(|x-X0|/HILL_TAIL_CUTOFF*SCALE)^Q_EXP)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_hill_tail_cutoff

metaInfos.description: Specifies whether an extended-lagrangian should be used. Default .FALSE.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_lagrange

metaInfos.description: If a Lagrangian scheme is used the eq. motion of the COLVARS are integrated with a LANGEVIN scheme.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_langevin

metaInfos.description: Specifies the colvar on which to apply metadynamics.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_colvar

metaInfos.description: Specifies the friction term in Langevin integration of the collective variable in the extended lagrangian scheme.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_gamma

metaInfos.description: Specifies the lambda parameter of the collective variable in the extended lagrangian scheme.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_lambda

metaInfos.description: Specifies the mass parameter of the collective variable in the extended lagrangian scheme.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_mass

metaInfos.description: Specifies the scale factor for the following collective variable. The history dependent term has the expression: WW * Sum_{j=1}^{nhills} Prod_{k=1}^{ncolvar} [EXP[-0.5*((ss-ss0(k,j))/SCALE(k))^2]], where ncolvar is the number of defined METAVAR and nhills is the number of spawned hills.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_scale

metaInfos.description: Specify the width of the gaussian: WW*e^(-((CV-POS)/sigma)^2)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_wall_gaussian_sigma

metaInfos.description: Specify the height of the gaussian: WW*e^(-((CV-POS)/sigma)^2)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_wall_gaussian_ww

metaInfos.description: Specify the value of the colvar for the wall position
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_wall_position

metaInfos.description: Specify the direction of the wall.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_wall_quadratic_direction

metaInfos.description: Specify the value of the quadratic potential constant: K*(CV-POS)^2
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_wall_quadratic_k

metaInfos.description: Specify the direction of the wall.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_wall_quartic_direction

metaInfos.description: Specify the value of the quartic potential constant: K*(CV-(POS+/-(1/K^(1/4))))^4
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_wall_quartic_k

metaInfos.description: Specify the direction of the wall.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_wall_reflective_direction

metaInfos.description: Specify the type of wall
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_metavar_wall_type

metaInfos.description: Minimum displacement between hills before placing a new hill.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_free_energy_metadyn_min_disp

metaInfos.description: Specify the minimum MD step interval between spawning two hills. If specified, it must be >= than NT_HILLS. In case MIN_DISP is used, if MIN_DISP is satisfied before MIN_NT_HILLS MD steps have been performed, the MD will continue without any spawning until MIN_NT_HILLS is reached. The default value has the net effect of skipping this check.

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_cg_fletcher_reeves

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_cg_line_search_2pnt_linmin_grad_only

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_cg_line_search_2pnt_max_allowed_step

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_cg_line_search_gold_brack_limit

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_cg_line_search_gold_brent_max_iter

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_cg_line_search_gold_brent_tol

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_cg_line_search_gold_initial_step

metaInfos.description: 1D line search algorithm to be used with the CG optimizer, in increasing order of robustness and cost.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_cg_line_search_type

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_cg_max_steep_steps

metaInfos.description: Cosine of the angle between two consecutive searching directions. If the angle during a CG optimization is less than the one corresponding to  to the RESTART_LIMIT the CG is reset and one step of steepest descent is  performed.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_cg_restart_limit

metaInfos.description: Maximum number of force evaluations per iteration(used for the line search)
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_lbfgs_max_f_per_iter

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_motion_shell_opt_lbfgs_max_h_rank

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_multiple_force_evals_multiple_subsys

metaInfos.description: If multiple atomic kinds are fitted at the same time, this keyword allows to specify which basis sets should be used together in optimization (underived set ID=0). If skipped all combinations are used. The order is taken as the kinds and sets are specified in the input
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_basis_combinations

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_basis_output_file

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_basis_work_file

metaInfos.description: This keyword allows to give different weight factors to the condition number of different basis combinations (LOG(cond) is used). The first entry corresponds to the original basis sets. Every further value is assigned to the combinations in the order given for BASIS_COMBINATIONS.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_condition_weight

metaInfos.description: The name of the basis set for the kind. Has to be specified in BASIS_TEMPLATE_FILE.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_fit_kind_basis_set

metaInfos.description: Defines the boundaries to which the optimization is restricted. First value is the lower bound, second value is the upper bound.

metaInfos.description: Defines the maximum fractionr by which the exponent is allowed to vary. e.g. 0.5 allows the exp to vary by 0.5*exp in both directions.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_fit_kind_constrain_exponents_max_var_fraction

metaInfos.description: Defines the exponent to be constraint. The two integers indicate the set number and i'th exponent. The value -1 can be used to mark all sets/expoenents in a set.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_fit_kind_constrain_exponents_use_exp

metaInfos.description: Specifies the reference basis ID which is used as template to create the new set. The original basis has ID 0. All follwing sets are counted in order as specified in the Input. The decriptors always assume the structure of the input basis set.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_fit_kind_derived_basis_sets_reference_set

metaInfos.description: Can be used to remove a contraction from the reference basis set. The contraction is speciefied by set number, angular momentum and number of contraction. The decriptors always assume the structure of the input basis set.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_fit_kind_derived_basis_sets_remove_contraction

metaInfos.description: Can be used to remove a set from the reference basis set.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_fit_kind_derived_basis_sets_remove_set

metaInfos.description: Specifies the initial degrees of freedom in the basis optimization.This can be used to make further specifications easier
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_fit_kind_initial_degrees_of_freedom

metaInfos.description: The name of the kind described in this section.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_fit_kind_section_parameters

metaInfos.description: Allows to switch the state of a given coefficient from current state (varibale/fixed)) to the opposite state. The three integers indicate the set number, the angular momentum i'th contraction and i'th coefficient
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_fit_kind_switch_coeff_state

metaInfos.description: Allows to switch the state of a given contraction from current state (varibale/fixed)) to the opposite state. The three integers indicate the set number, the angular momentum and i'th contraction
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_fit_kind_switch_contraction_state

metaInfos.description: Allows to switch the state of a given exponent from current state (varibale/fixed)) to the opposite state. The two integers indicate the set number and i'th exponent
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_fit_kind_switch_exp_state

metaInfos.description: Allows to switch the states of in a set from current state (varibale/fixed)) to the opposite state. The two integers indicate the affected part (0=ALL,1=EXPS,2=COEFF) and i'th set
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_input_optimize_basis_fit_kind_switch_set_state

metaInfos.description: Allows the specification of the group mpi group sizes in parallel runs. metaInfos.description: controls part of the filename for output.  use __STD_OUT__ (exactly as written here) for the screen or standard logger.  use filename to obtain projectname-filename.  use ./filename to get filename. metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mixed_mapping_force_eval

metaInfos.description: Defines the mapping of atoms for the different force_eval with the mixed force_eval. The default is to have a mapping 1-1 between atom index (i.e. all force_eval share the same geometrical structure). The mapping is based on defining fragments and the mapping the  fragments between the several force_eval and the mixed force_eval

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mixed

metaInfos.description: Specifies the Urey-Bradley potential between the external atoms defining the angle
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_bend_ub

metaInfos.description: Specifies the bend potential of the MM system.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_bend

metaInfos.description: Specifies the bond potential
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_bond

metaInfos.description: Allow to specify an array of classical charges, thus avoiding the packing and permitting the usage of different charges for same atomic types.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_charges

metaInfos.description: This section specifies the charge of the MM atoms
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_charge

metaInfos.description: This section specifies optional electric field damping for the polarizable atoms.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_dipole_damping

metaInfos.description: This section specifies that we will perform an SCF dipole calculation of the MM atoms. Needs KEYWORD POL_SCF in POISSON secton
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_dipole

metaInfos.description: Specifies the improper torsion potential of the MM system.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_improper

metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for BMHFTD potential type.Functional form: V(r) = A*exp(-B*r) - f_6*(r)C/r^6 - f_8(r)*D/r^8.where f_order(r)=1-exp(-BD * r) * \sum_{k=0}^order (BD * r)^k / k! .(Tang-Toennies damping function)No values available inside cp2k.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded_bmhftd

metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for BMHFT potential type.Functional form: V(r) = A * EXP(-B*r) - C/r^6 - D/r^8.Values available inside cp2k only for the Na/Cl pair.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded_bmhft

metaInfos.description:
This section specifies the input parameters for the Buckingham 4-ranges potential type. Functional form:
  • V(r) = A*EXP(-B*r) for r < r1
  • V(r) = Sum_n POLY1(n)*rn for r1 â¤ r < r2
  • V(r) = Sum_n POLY2(n)*rn for r2 â¤ r < r3
  • V(r) = -C/r6 for r â¥ r3
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded_buck4ranges

metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for Buckingham plus Morse potential type  Functional Form: V(r) = F0*(B1+B2)*EXP([A1+A2-r]/[B1+B2])-C/r^6+D*{EXP[-2*beta*(r-R0)]-2*EXP[-beta*(r-R0)]}.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded_buckmorse

metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for EAM potential type.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded_eam

metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for a generic potential type.A functional form is specified. Mathematical Operators recognized are +, -, *, /, ** or alternatively ^, whereas symbols for brackets must be (). The function parser recognizes the (single argument) Fortran 90 intrinsic functions abs, exp, log10, log, sqrt, sinh, cosh, tanh, sin, cos, tan, asin, acos, atan. Parsing for INTRINSIC functions is CASE INsensitive.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded_genpot

metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for GOODWIN potential type.Functional form: V(r) = EXP(M*(-(r/DC)**MC+(D/DC)**MC))*VR0*(D/r)**M.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded_goodwin

metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for IPBV potential type.Functional form: Implicit table function.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded_ipbv

metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for LENNARD-JONES potential type.Functional form: V(r) = 4.0 * EPSILON * [(SIGMA/r)^12-(SIGMA/r)^6].
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded_lennard_jones

metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for QUIP potential type. Mainly intended for things like GAP corrections to DFT to achieve correlated-wavefunction-like accuracy. Requires linking with quip library from http://www.libatoms.org .
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded_quip

metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for the Siepmann-Sprik potential type. Consist of 4 terms: T1+T2+T3+T4. The terms T1=A/rij^alpha and T2=-C/rij^6 have to be given via the GENPOT section. The terms T3+T4 are obtained from the SIEPMANN section.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded_siepmann

metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for Tersoff potential type.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded_tersoff

metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for WILLIAMS potential type.Functional form: V(r) = A*EXP(-B*r) - C / r^6 .
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded_williams

metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for a generic potential type.A functional form is specified. Mathematical Operators recognized are +, -, *, /, ** or alternatively ^, whereas symbols for brackets must be (). The function parser recognizes the (single argument) Fortran 90 intrinsic functions abs, exp, log10, log, sqrt, sinh, cosh, tanh, sin, cos, tan, asin, acos, atan. Parsing for INTRINSIC functions is CASE INsensitive.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded14_genpot

metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for GOODWIN potential type.Functional form: V(r) = EXP(M*(-(r/DC)**MC+(D/DC)**MC))*VR0*(D/r)**M.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded14_goodwin

metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_mm_forcefield_nonbonded14_lennard_jones

metaInfos.description: This section specifies how often this proprety is printed.Each keyword inside this section is mapping to a specific iteration level and the value of each of these keywords is matched with the iteration level during the calculation. How to handle the last iteration is treated separately in ADD_LAST (this mean that each iteration level (MD, GEO_OPT, etc..), though equal to 0, might print the last iteration). If an iteration level is specified that is not present in the flow of the calculation it is just ignored.

metaInfos.description: Requests a RESP fit of charges. When using a periodic Poisson solver and a periodic cell, the periodic RESP routines are used. If the Hartree potential matches with the one of an isolated system (i.e. isolated Poisson solver and big, nonperiodic cells), the nonperiodic RESP routines are automatically used. The subsections NONPERIODIC_SYS and PERIODIC_SYS do not request a nonperiodic or periodic solution, they only determine the sampling of the fitting points. All restraints are harmonic!
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_properties_resp

metaInfos.description: This section enables and defines parameters for force-mixing based QM/MM, which actually does two conventional QM/MM calculations, on a small  and a large QM region, and combines the MM forces from one and QM  forces from the other to create a complete set of forces.  Energy is  not conserved (although the QM/MM energy from the large QM region calculation is reported)  so a proper thermostat (i.e. massive, and able to handle dissipation, such as  Adaptive Langevin (AD_LANGEVIN)) must be used. For some propagation algorithms  (NVT and REFTRAJ MD ensembles) algorithm is adaptive,  including molecules hysteretically based on their instantaneous distance from the core region.  Information on core/QM/buffer labels can be written in PDB file using  MOTION&PRINT&FORCE_MIXING_LABELS.  Will fail if calculation requires a  meaningfull stress, or an energy that is consistent with the forces.  For GEO_OPT this means  only MOTION&GEO_OPT&TYPE CG, MOTION&GEO_OPT&CG&LINE_SEARCH&TYPE 2PNT, and  MOTION&GEO_OPT&CG&LINE_SEARCH&2PNT&LINMIN_GRAD_ONLY T
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_qmmm_force_mixing

metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for a generic potential type.A functional form is specified. Mathematical Operators recognized are +, -, *, /, ** or alternatively ^, whereas symbols for brackets must be (). The function parser recognizes the (single argument) Fortran 90 intrinsic functions abs, exp, log10, log, sqrt, sinh, cosh, tanh, sin, cos, tan, asin, acos, atan. Parsing for INTRINSIC functions is CASE INsensitive.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_qmmm_forcefield_nonbonded_genpot

metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for GOODWIN potential type.Functional form: V(r) = EXP(M*(-(r/DC)**MC+(D/DC)**MC))*VR0*(D/r)**M.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_qmmm_forcefield_nonbonded_goodwin

metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for LENNARD-JONES potential type.Functional form: V(r) = 4.0 * EPSILON * [(SIGMA/r)^12-(SIGMA/r)^6].
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_force_eval_qmmm_forcefield_nonbonded_lennard_jones

metaInfos.description: This section specifies the input parameters for WILLIAMS potential type.Functional form: V(r) = A*EXP(-B*r) - C / r^6 .

metaInfos.description: Controls the set of parameters to run a Langevin MD. The integrator used follows that given in the article by Ricci et al. The user can define regions in the system where the atoms inside undergoes Langevin MD, while those outside the regions undergoes NVE Born Oppenheimer MD. To define the regions, the user should use THERMAL_REGION subsection of MOTION%MD. The theory for Langevin MD involving sub-regions can be found in articles by Kantorovitch et al. All the references can be found in the links below.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_md_langevin

metaInfos.description: Multiple timestep integration based on RESPA (implemented for NVE only). RESPA exploits multiple force_eval. In this case the order of the force_eval maps  the order of the respa shells from the slowest to the fastest force evaluation. If force_evals share the same subsys, it's enough then to specify the  subsys in the force_eval corresponding at the first index in the multiple_force_eval list. Can be used to speedup classical and ab initio MD simulations.
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_md_respa

metaInfos.description: A method to initialize the velocities along low-curvature directions in order to favors MD trajectories to cross rapidly over small energy barriers into neighboring basins. In each iteration the forces are calculated at a point y, which is slightly displaced from the current positions x in the direction of the original velocities v. The velocities are then updated with the force component F_t, which is perpendicular to N. N = v / |v|;  y = x + delta * N;  F_t = F(y) - â© F(y) | N âª * N; v' = v + alpha * F_t
metaInfos.name: x_cp2k_section_input_motion_md_velocity_softening

metaInfos.description: This section specifies how often this proprety is printed.Each keyword inside this section is mapping to a specific iteration level and the value of each of these keywords is matched with the iteration level during the calculation. How to handle the last iteration is treated separately in ADD_LAST (this mean that each iteration level (MD, GEO_OPT, etc..), though equal to 0, might print the last iteration). If an iteration level is specified that is not present in the flow of the calculation it is just ignored.

metaInfos.description: This section specifies how often this proprety is printed.Each keyword inside this section is mapping to a specific iteration level and the value of each of these keywords is matched with the iteration level during the calculation. How to handle the last iteration is treated separately in ADD_LAST (this mean that each iteration level (MD, GEO_OPT, etc..), though equal to 0, might print the last iteration). If an iteration level is specified that is not present in the flow of the calculation it is just ignored.

metaInfos.description: This section specifies the TMC move type, and its properties. Selectable types are: ATOM_TRANS atom translation, MOL_TRANS molecule translation, MOL_ROT molecule rotation, PROT_REORDER proton reordering, PT_SWAP Parallel Tempering swap, VOL_MOVE volume change, ATOM_SWAP swaps two atoms of different type.
